revised_title: Mesoscale Synoptic Features and Spruce Budworm Moth Dispersal in Eastern Canada
tldr: This article discusses the detection of mesoscale synoptic features associated with the dispersal of spruce budworm moths in eastern Canada. Radar studies revealed that strong thermal contrasts between land and sea surfaces led to significant redistribution of the airborne moths. Meteorologists identified synoptic situations that favored the development of these mesoscale features, which helped in forecasting and monitoring insect populations and controlling epidemic outbreaks.
